definition[0]: a cloudy sky, day etc is dark because there are a lot of clouds
example[0]: a cloudy night with some light rain
example[1]: Tomorrow, it will be cloudy and cool.
definition[2]: cloudy thoughts, memories etc are not very clear or exact
example[3]: The weather was cold and cloudy.
definition[4]: grey in colour, because there are dark clouds â€“ used especially in written descriptions
example[5]: Mary looked out at the cold grey sky.
definition[5]: dark and completely covered with clouds
definition[6]: a leaden sky is grey and full of dark clouds
example[7]: Snow fell from a leaden sky.
definition[7]: dark and cloudy, in a depressing way
example[8]: The gloomy weather shows no sign of improving.
definition[8]: with thick low cloud that is difficult to see through. You use foggy  especially about low-lying places
example[9]: a foggy day in London in November
definition[9]: with light low cloud that is difficult to see through. You use misty especially about places that are next to water or in the mountains
definition[10]: with air that looks cloudy, because there is smoke, dust, or mist in it
